result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L. Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possesses Illegal Article, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 302.095(2)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: On Count #2 of Case 22CF164, The Court sentences the Defendant to  3  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 18 months.   This sentence is to be served concurrent to  22CF149,20CM116,22CF164--Count #3,21CF318,21CF186,22CT46, but consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: --to pay costs, fees, and surcharges including the restitution as ordered in Case 21CF186.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education programming as approved by the Agent

--no possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription

--to take all prescription medications only as prescribed

--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores

--no contact with any know drug offender except for treatment or as deemed appropriate per Agent

--if permitted to travel out of State, no possession or use of marijuana(THC) in states where it is legal. No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without express written permission of agent

--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent

--to be subject to random drug/alcohol screening

supervisions.notes: On Count #3 of Case 22CF164, The Court sentences the Defendant to  4  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years.  This sentence is to be served concurrent to  22CF149,20CM116,22CF164--Count #2,21CF318,21CF186,22CT46, but consecutive to any other sentence.

w/ elements and ccs

[ma] Cases 22CF149,20CM116,22CF164,21CF318,21CF186,22CT46 called at 8:49am 
Defendant Michael L. Miller appeared via zoom from Jackson Correctional, in custody.    Attorney Thomas James appeared by zoom for Michael L. Miller. Attorney Monica J. Hall by zoom for State of Wisconsin.

Arraignment occurs in Cases 22CF149, 22CF164, 21CF318, 21CF186:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Constitutional rights reviewed;
Plea of " NO CONTEST  " entered to Case 20CM116; 
Plea of "  NO CONTEST  " entered to Case 21CF186; 
Plea of " NO CONTEST   " entered to Count #1 of Case 22CT46; 
Pleas of " NO CONTEST   " entered to Counts #1 and #2 of Case 21CF318; 
Pleas of " NO CONTEST   " entered to Counts #1 and #2 of Case 22CF149; 
Pleas of " NO CONTEST   " entered to Counts#2 and #3 of Case22CF164; 
Factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses:
--Counts #2 and #3 of Case 22CT46
--Counts #3 and #4 of Case 21CF318
--Counts #3, #4, and #5 of Case 22CF149
--Counts #1, #4, #5  and #6of Case 22CF164
--Uncharged DA Case # 22JE549, DOV: 7/29/17

Sentencing arguments/recommendations given by Counsel 
Statement made by Defendant

On Case 20CM116, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 90  days jail, with Huber privileges; concurrent to sentences in 22CF149,22CF164,21CF318,21CF186,22CT46, but consecutive to any other sentence. 
--4 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge, to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.


On Case 21CF186, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 6 months jail, with Huber privileges; concurrent to sentences in 22CF149,20CM116,22CF164,21CF318,22CT46, but consecutive to any other sentence. 
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge, to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
--The Court orders payment of restitution in the amount of $2600 to Victim's estate, to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

On Count #1 of Case 22CT46, the Court sentences the Defendant: 

--To serve 5 months jail, with Huber privileges; concurrent to sentences 22CF149,20CM116,22CF164,21CF318,21CF186,but consecutive to any other sentence. 
--Days credit for time already served: 0 days
--To pay fine of $450+ costs, plus $56.74 in blood testing fees, to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
--Revocation of drivers license for 14 months
--AODA assessment and follow through 
--Victim Impact Panel attendance 
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 14 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

On Count #1 of Case 21CF318, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 60 days jail, with Huber privileges; concurrent to sentences in 22CF149,20CM116,22CF164,21CF318--Count #2,21CF186,22CT46
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge, to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.


On Count #2 of Case 21CF318, The Court sentences the Defendant to  3  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 18 months.  This sentence is to be served concurrent to  22CF149,20CM116,22CF164,21CF318--Count #1,21CF186,22CT46, but consecutive to any other sentence. 

On Count #1 of Case 22CF149, The Court sentences the Defendant to  3  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 18 months.    This sentence is to be served concurrent to  22CF149--Count #2,20CM116,22CF164,21CF318,21CF186,22CT46, but consecutive to any other sentence. 

On Count #2 of Case 22CF149, The Court sentences the Defendant to  3  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 18 months.   This sentence is to be served concurrent to  22CF149--Count #1,20CM116,22CF164,21CF318,21CF186,22CT46, but consecutive to any other sentence. 

On Count #2 of Case 22CF164, The Court sentences the Defendant to  3  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 18 months.   This sentence is to be served concurrent to  22CF149,20CM116,22CF164--Count #3,21CF318,21CF186,22CT46, but consecutive to any other sentence. 

On Count #3 of Case 22CF164, The Court sentences the Defendant to  4  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years.  This sentence is to be served concurrent to  22CF149,20CM116,22CF164--Count #2,21CF318,21CF186,22CT46, but consecutive to any other sentence. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment 
--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education programming as approved by the Agent
--no possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescription medications only as prescribed
--to be subject to random drug/alcohol screening
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no contact with any know drug offender except for treatment or as deemed appropriate per Agent
--if permitted to travel out of State, no possession or use of marijuana(THC) in states where it is legal. No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without express written permission of agent
--to pay costs, fees, and surcharges including the restitution as ordered in Case 21CF186.


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 9:39am

[ml] Cases 20CM116, 21CF186, 21CF318, 22CF149, 22CF164, and 22CT46 called at 9:05AM
Defendant Michael L. Miller in court, in custody with attorney Thomas James. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Files 21CF186, 21CF318, 22CF149, and 22CF164 are scheduled for Preliminary Hearings, however the Defense files waiver paperwork prior to the case being called. The Court proceeds with Waivers or Preliminary Hearings:

Mr. Miller waives his right to Preliminary Hearings; the Court accepts these waivers and binds him over for Trials.

The Defense advises that the Defendant is willing to accept the State's offer, and requests that Arraignments be set over the the next hearing, and that this hearing will be a Plea and Sentencing. The State has no objection.

The Defendant requests that the next hearing be conducted by Zoom. The Defendant advises that he understands his right to be present for the next hearing, and that he waives this right
